question: ...My esteemed colleagues, excuse me... I have just received some tragic and disturbing news. Senator Amidala of the Naboo system... Has been assassinated! This grievous blow is especially personal to me. Before I became Chancellor, I served Amidala when she was Queen. She was a great leader who fought for justice, not only in this honourable assembly, but also on her home planet. She was so loved she could have been elected queen for life. She believed in public service, and she fervently believed in democracy. Her death is a great loss to us all. We will all mourn her as a relentless champion of freedom... and as a dear friend. Must I remind the Senator from Malastare that negotiations are continuing with the separatists. Peace is our objective here... not war. It is with great surprise and joy the chair recognises the Senator from Naboo, Padm Amidala. Due to the lateness of the hour and the seriousness of this motion, we will take up these matters tomorrow. Until then, the Senate stands adjourned. I don't know how much longer I can hold off the vote, my friends. More and more star systems are joining the separatists.
answer: If they do break away -

question: No! I will not let that happen!
answer: But if they do, you must realise there aren't enough Jedi to protect the Republic. We are keepers of the peace, not soldiers.

question: We're here to protect you Senator, not to start an investigation.
answer: We will find out who is trying to kill you Padm, I promise you.

question: We are not going to exceed our mandate, my young Padawan learner.
answer: I meant in the interest of protecting her, Master, of course.

question: We are not going through this exercise again, Anakin. You will pay attention to my lead.
answer: Why?

question: What??!!
answer: Why else do you think we were assigned to her, if not to find the killer? Protection is a job for local security... not Jedi. It's overkill, Master. Investigation is implied in our mandate.

question: Why couldn't we see this attack on the Senator?
answer: Masking the future, is this disturbance in the Force.

question: The propecy is coming true, the Dark Side is growing.
answer: And only those who have turned to the Dark Side can sense the possibilities of the future. Only going through the Dark Side can we see.

question: It's been ten years, and the Sith still have no shown themselves. Do you think they are behind this?
answer: ...Out there, they are. A certainty that is.

question: Do you think Obi-Wan's apprentice will be able to bring balance to the Force?
answer: Only if he chooses to follow his destiny.

question: Captain Typho has more than enough men downstairs. No assassin will try that way. Any activity up here?
answer: Quiet as a tomb. I don't like just waiting here for something to happen to her.

question: What's going on?
answer: She covered that camera. I don't think she liked me watching her.

question: What is she thinking?
answer: She programmed Artoo to warn us if there's an intruder.

question: It's not an intruder I'm worried about. There are many other ways to kill a Senator.
answer: I know, but we also want to catch this assassin. Don't we, Master?

question: You're using her as bait??
answer: It was her idea... No harm will come to her. I can sense everything going on in that room. Trust me.

question: It's too risky... and your senses aren't that attuned, young apprentice.
answer: And yours are?

question: Possibly. You look tired.
answer: I don't sleep well, anymore.

question: Because of your mother?
answer: I don't know why I keep dreaming About her now. I haven't seen her since I was little.

question: Dreams pass in time.
answer: I'd rather dream of Padm. Just Being around her again is... intoxicating.

question: Mind your thoughts, Anakin, they betray you. You've made a commitment to the Jedi order... a commitment not easily broken... and don't forget she's a politician. They're not to be trusted.
answer: She's not like the others in the Senate, Master.

question: It's been my experience that Senators are only focused on pleasing those who fund their campaigns... and they are more than willing to forget the niceties of democracy to get those funds.
answer: Not another lecture, Master. Not on the economics of politics.... It's too early in the morning... and besides, you're generalising. The Chancellor doesn't appear to be corrupt.

question: Palpatine's a politician, I've observed that he is very clever at following the passions and prejudices of the Senators.
answer: I think he is a good man. My instincts are very positive about...

question: I sense it, too.
answer: Stay here!

question: I have a bad feeling about this.
answer: That was wacky! I almost lost you in the traffic.

question: What took you so long?
answer: Oh, you know, Master, I couldn't find a speeder I really liked, with an open cockpit... and with the right speed capabilities... and then you know I had to get a really gonzo color...

question: If you'd spend as much time working on your saber skills as you do on your wit, young Padawan, you would rival Master Yoda as a swordsman.
answer: I thought I already did.

question: Only in your mind, my very young apprentice. Careful!! Hey, easy!!
answer: Sorry, I forgot you don't like flying, Master.

question: I don't mind flying... but what you're doing is suicide!
answer: Master, you know I've been flying since before I could walk. I'm very good at this.

question: Just slow down! Wait! Don't go in there! You know I don't like it when you do that!
answer: Sorry, Master. Don't worry, this guy's gonna kill himself any minute now!

question: What are you doing? He's gonna blast me!
answer: Right - this isn't working.

question: That was too close!
answer: Clear that!

question: What??
answer: Clear the flag! We're losing power! Hurry!

question: Whooooaaa! Don't do that! I don't like it when you do that!
answer: So sorry, Master.

question: It's dangerous near those power couplings! Slow down! Don't go through there! Yiiii, what are you doing?
answer: Sorry, Master!

question: Oh, that was good...
answer: That was crazy!!! Ahh, damn.

question: Stop!!
answer: No, we can make it.

question: I'm crazy... I'm crazy... I'm crazy.
answer: But it worked... we made it.

question: It didn't work... we've stalled! And you almost got us killed!
answer: I think we're still alive.

question: It was stupid!
answer: I could have made it...

question: But you didn't!!! And now we've lost him.
answer: No we didnt...

question: Where are you going?! He went down there, the other way.
answer: This is a shortcut... I think.

question: What do you mean, You think? What kind of shortcut?! He went completely the other way! Youve lost him!
answer: Master, if we keep this chase going, that creeps gonna end up deep fried. Personally, Id very much like to find out who in the hell he is and who hes working for...

question: Oh, so thats why were going in the wrong direction. Well, you lost him.
answer: Im deeply sorry, Master. Excuse me for a moment.

question: Anakin!
answer: She went into that club, Master.

question: Patience. Here. Next time try not to lose it.
answer: Sorry, Master.

question: A Jedi's saber is his most precious possession.
answer: Yes, Master.

question: He must keep it with him at all times.
answer: I know, Master.

question: This weapon is your life!
answer: I've heard this lesson before...

question: But, you haven't learned anything, Anakin.
answer: I try, Master.

question: Why do I think you are going to be the death of me?!
answer: Don't say that Master... You're the closest thing I have to a father... I love you. I don't want to cause you pain.

question: Then why don't you listen to me?!
answer: I will. I'll do better, I promise.

question: Do you see him him?
answer: I think he's a she...

question: Then be extra careful... Check it out.
answer: Where are you going, Master?

question: To get a drink. You don't want to sell me death- sticks. You want to go home and rethink your life.
answer: Easy... Official business. Go back to your drinks.

question: Do you know who it was you were trying to kill? Who hired you?
answer: Tell us!

question: This wound's going to need treatment.
answer: Who hired you? Tell us... tell us now!

question: Anakin, you stay put on Naboo. Do not attract any attention. Do absolutely nothing without checking in with me or the Council.
answer: Yes, Master.

question: I will get to the bottom of this plot quickly, M'Lady. You'll be back here in no time.
answer: Time to go.

question: May the Force be with you.
answer: May the Force be with you, Master. I'm kinda scared too. This is my first assignment on my own.

question: I'm looking for Dexter. He's not in trouble. It's personal.
answer: Obi-Wan!

question: Hey, Dex.
answer: Take a seat! Be right with ya!

question: Thank you.
answer: Hey, ol' buddy!

question: Hey, Dex.
answer: So, my friend. What can I do for ya?

question: You can tell me what this is.
answer: Well, whattaya know... I ain't seen one of these since I was prospecting on Subterrel beyond the Outer Rim!

question: Do you know where it came from?
answer: This baby belongs to them cloners. What you got here is a Kamino Kyberdart.

question: Kamino Kyberdart... I wonder why it didn't show up in any analysis archive.
answer: It's these funny little cuts on the side give it away... Those analysis droids you've got over there only focus on symbols, you know. I should think you Jedi would have more respect for the difference between knowledge and wisdom.

question: Well, Dex, if droids could think, we wouldn't be here, would we? Kamino... doesn't sound familiar. Is it part of the Republic?
answer: No, it's beyond the Outer Rim. I'd say about twelve parsecs outside the Rishi Maze, toward the south. It should be easy to find, even for those droids in your archive to find. Those Kaminoans keep to themselves. They're cloners. Damned good ones, too.

question: Cloners? Are they friendly?
answer: It depends.

question: On what, Dex?
answer: On how good your manners are... and how big your pocketbook is...

question: We've been worried about you. I'm so glad you're safe, Padm.
answer: Given the circumstances, Senator, you know it was the only decision Her Highness could have made.

question: How many systems have joined Count Dooku and the separatists?
answer: It's unthinkable! There hasn't been a full-scale war since the formation of the Republic!

question: Do you see any way, through negotiations, to bring the separatists back into the Republic? The armies of commerce! Why has Nothing been done in the Senate to restrain them?
answer: It's outrageous! After all of those hearings, and the four trials in the Supreme Court, Nute Gunray is still the Viceroy of the Trade Federation. Do those money mongers control everything?

question: Did you call for assistance?
answer: Yes... yes, I did...

question: He has a powerful face, doesn't he? He was one of the most brilliant Jedi I have had the privilege of knowing.
answer: I never understood why he quit. Only twenty Jedi have ever left the Order.

question: The Lost Twenty... and Count Dooku was the most recent and the most painful. No one likes to talk about it. His leaving was a great loss to the Order.
answer: What happened?

question: Well, one might say, he was always a bit out of step with the decisions of the Council... much like your old Master, Qui-Gon Jinn.
answer: Really?

question: Oh, yes. They were alike in many ways. Very individual thinkers... idealists... (continuing He was always striving to become a more powerful Jedi. He wanted to be the best. With a lightsaber, in the old style of fencing, he had no match. His knowledge of the Force was... unique. In the end, I think he left because he lost faith in the Republic. He believed that politics were corrupt, and he felt the Jedi betrayed themselves by serving the politicians. He always had very high expectations of government. He disappeared for nine or ten years, then he just showed up recently as the head of the separatist movement.
answer: Interesting... I'm still not sure I understand.

question: Well, I'm sure you didn't call me over here for a history lesson. Are you having a problem, Master Kenobi?
answer: Yes, I'm trying to find a planet system called Kamino. It doesn't seem to show upon any of the archive charts.

question: Kamino? It's not a system I'M familiar with... Let me see... Are you sure you have the right co-ordinates?
answer: According to my information, it should be in this quadrant somewhere... just south of the Rishi Maze.

question: No co-ordinates? It sounds like the kind of directions you'd get from a street tout... some old miner or Furbog trader.
answer: All three actually.

question: Are you sure it exists?
answer: Absolutely.

question: Let me do a gravitational scan. There are some inconsistencies here. Maybe the planet you're looking for was destroyed.
answer: Wouldn't that be on record?

question: It ought to be. Unless it was very recent. I hate to say it, but it looks like the system you're searching for doesn't exist.
answer: That's impossible... perhaps the archives are incomplete.

question: I don't either.
answer: Don't worry, this won't take long.

question: I just want to get there before dark. You still live at home.
answer: I move around so much, I've never had a place of my own. Official residences have no warmth. I feel good here. I feel at home.

question: I never had a real home. Home was always where my Mom was. Is this you?
answer: That was when I went with the Relief Group to Shadda-Bi-Boran. Their sun was imploding, and the planet was dying. I was helping to relocate the children. See that little one I'm holding? His name was N'a-kee-tula, which means sweethear. He was so full of life,. All those kids were. I did everything I could to save him, but he died... they all did. They were never able to adapt... to live off their native planet. My first day as an Apprentice Legislator. Notice the difference?

question: Don't think... feel... be as one with the Force. Help you, it will. Younglings - enough! A visitor we have. Welcome him. Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, meet the mighty Bear Clan.
answer: I am sorry to disturb you, Master.

question: What help to you, can I be?
answer: Im looking for a planet described to me by an old friend. I trust him. But the system doesnt show up on the archive maps.

question: An interesting puzzle. Gather round the map reader, younglings. Master Obi-Wan has lost a planet. Find it, we will try...
answer: This is where it ought to be... but it isnt. Gravity is pulling all the stars in this area inward to this spot. There should be a star here... but there isnt.

question: Most interesting. Gravitys silhouette remains, but the star and all its planets have disappeared. How can this be? Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is. Uncluttered. To the centre of the pull of gravity go, and find your planet you will.
answer: But Master Yoda who could have erased information from the archives? Thats impossible, isnt it?

question: But he still has much to learn. And his abilities have made him... well... arrogant. I realise now what you and Master Yoda knew from the beginning... the boy was too old to start the training and...
answer: There's something else?

question: Master, he should not have been given this assignment. I'm afraid Anakin won't be able to protect the Senator.
answer: Why?

question: He has a... an emotional connection with her. It's been there since he was boy. Now he's confused... distracted. Has Master Yoda gained any insight into whether or not this war will come about?
answer: Probing the Dark Side is a dangerous process. He could be in seclusion for days... May the force be with you.

question: You did that?
answer: What?

question: That! Now stop it! Anakin!!
answer: I'm not really supposed to do that... for fun, I mean. If Master Obi-Wan were here, he'd be very grumpy. May I tell you something?

question: I don't know.
answer: Then how can I tell you?

question: Maybe you should use your Jedi intuition.
answer: It doesn't work around you. My mind is always a muddle... I can only think of you.

question: Anakin, don't...
answer: From the moment I met you, all those years ago, a day hasn't gone by when I haven't thought of you. And now that I'm close to you again, I'm in agony. The closer I get to you, the worse it gets. The thought of not being with you mskes my stomach turn over - my mouth goes dry. I feel dizzy. I can't breathe. I'm haunted by the kiss you should never have given me. My heart is beating, hoping that kiss will not become a scar. You are in my very soul, tormenting me. What can I do? I will do anything you ask... If you are suffering as much as I am, tell me.

question: ...I can't. We can't. It's just not possible.
answer: Anything's possible. Padme, please listen...

question: You listen. We live in a real world. Come back to it. You're studying to become a Jedi Knight. I'm a Senator. If you follow your thoughts through to conclusion, they will take us to a place we cannot go... regardless of the way we feel about each other.
answer: Then you do feel something! There's an extraordinary connection between us. You can't deny that.

question: Annie, it doesn't make any difference. Jedi aren't allowed to marry. You swore an oath, remember? You'd be expelled from the Order. I will not let you give up your responsibilities... your future, for me.
answer: I was destined to be a Jedi. I don't think I could be anything else. But you are asking me to be rational. That is something I know I cannot do. I wish I could wish my feelings away... but I can't.

question: I am not going to give into this. I'm not going to throw my life away. I have more important things to do than fall in love.
answer: It wouldn't have to be that way... we could keep it a secret.

question: Then we'd be living a lie - one we couldn't keep even if we wanted to. Mt sister saw it. So did my mother. I couldn't do that. Could you, Anakin? Could you live like that?
answer: ...No, you're right. It would destroy us.

question: Obi-Wan Kenobi.
answer: Please... I trust you are going to enjoy your stay. We are most happy you have arrived at the best part of the season.

question: You make me feel most welcome.
answer: And now to business. You will be delighted to hear we are on schedule. Two hundred thousand units are ready, with another million well on the way.

question: That is... good news.
answer: Please tell your Master Sido-Dyas that we have every confidence his order will be met on time and in full. He is well, I hope?

question: I'm sorry Master - ?
answer: Jedi Master Sifo-Dyas. He's still a leading member of the Jedi Council, is he not?

question: Oh, yes. Sido-Dyas.
answer: You must be anxious to inspect the units for yourself.

question: Sure you do... you just don't want to tell me. They only work on the weak-minded. You are anything but weak-minded. All right, I get the picture... whatever happened to him? Maybe he was the smart one.
answer: You really don't like politicians, do you?

question: I like two or three, but I'm not really sure about one of them. I don't think the system works.
answer: How would you have it work?

question: We need a system where the politicians sit down and discuss the problems, agree what's in the best interests of all the people, and then do it.
answer: That is exactly what we do. The trouble is that people don't wlways agree. In fact, they hardly ever do.

question: Then they should be made to.
answer: By whom? Who's going to make them?

question: I don't know. Someone.
answer: You?

question: Of course not me.
answer: But someone.

question: Someone wise.
answer: That sounds an awful lot like a dictatorship to me.

question: Magnificent, aren't they? We modified their genetic structure to make them less independent than the original host. As a result they are totally obedient, taking any order without question. A bounty hunter called Jango Fett. We felt a Jedi would be the perfect choice, but Sido-Dyas hand- picked Jango Fett himself.
answer: Where is this bounty hunter now?

question: Oh, we keep him here. After a few hundred thousand clones, the genetic pattern starts to fade, so we take a fresh supply. He lives here, but he's free to come and go as he pleases. Apart from his pay, which is considerable, Fett demanded only one thing - an unaltered clone for himself. Curious isn't it?
answer: Unaltered?

question: Pure genetic replication. No tampering with the structure to make it more docile... and no growth acceleration...
answer: I would like to meet this Jango Fett.

question: You mentioned growth acceleration...
answer: Oh yes, it's essential. Otherwise, a mature clone would take a lifetime to grow. Now, we can do it in half the time. Those items you saw on the parade ground were started ten years ago, when Sido-dyas first placed the order, and they're already mature...

question: And these?
answer: About five years ago. They're immensely superior to droids, capable of independent thought and action.

question: Very impressive.
answer: I'd hoped you would be pleased.

question: Tell me, prime minister, when my Master Sido-dyas first contacted you, did he say the order was for... himself... or?
answer: Himself? Of course not. This army is for the Republic?

question: The Repubic?
answer: We are also very much agasint this Count Dooku and his seccessionist movement. We are proud to be of help to the Republic.

question: No...No...No...Mom!...Don't, no, don't! Don't go. Your presence is soothing.
answer: You had a nightmare again last night.

question: Jedi don't have nightmares.
answer: I heard you.

question: I saw my mother. I saw her as clearly as I see you now. She's suffering, Padme. She is in pain...They're killing her! I know I'm disobeying my mandate to protect you, Senator. I know I will be punished and possibly thrown out of the Jedi Order, but I must go. I have to help her! I'm sorry, Padme. I don't have a choice.
answer: Annie, I told you I wouldn't let you give up your future for me. I'll go with you. That way you can continue to protect me, and you won't be disobeying your mandate.

question: What about Master Obi-wan?
answer: I guess we won't tell him, will we?

question: Aren't we all? Ever made your way as far into the interior as Coruscant?
answer: Once or twice.

question: Recently?
answer: Possibly...

question: Then you must know Master Sido- Dyas?
answer: Boba, close the door. Master who?

question: Sido-Dyas. Isnt he the Jedi who hired you for this job?
answer: Never heard of him. I was recuited by a man called Darth Tyranus on one of the moons of Bogden.

question: Curious...
answer: Do you like your army?

question: It seems to me it's your army - being that they are all clones of you.
answer: They'll do their job well, I'll guarantee that.

question: I look forward to seeing them in action. Thank you for your time, Jango.
answer: Always a pleasure to meet a Jedi.

question: Wait, please.
answer: No, not that one - that one!

question: Excuse me, Watto.
answer: What?

question: I said excuse me.
answer: Shut down. What? I don't know you... What can I do for you? You look like a Jedi. Whatever it is... I didn't do it.

question: Let me help you with that. I'm looking for Shmi Skywalker.
answer: Annie?? Little Annie?? Naaaah!! You are Annie! It is you! You little womp rat. You sure sprouted Weehoo! A Jedi! Waddya know? Hey, maybe you couldda help wit some daedbeats who owe...

question: My mother...
answer: Oh, yeah. Shmi... she's not mine no more. I sold her.

question: Sold her...
answer: Years ago. Sorry, Anne, but you know, business is business. Sold her to a moisture farmer named Lars. Least I think it was Lars. Believe it or not, I heard he freed her and married her. Can ya beat that?

question: Do you know where they are?
answer: Long way from here... someplace over on the other side of Mos Eisley, I think...

question: I'd like to know.
answer: Yeah... sure... absolutely. Let's go look in my records.

question: Stay with the ship, Artoo.
answer: Threepio?

question: Hello, Threepio.
answer: I've come to see my mother.

question: Threepio, what's happened?
answer: I'm Anakin Skywalker. I'm here looking for my mother.

question: Nearly there, son.
answer: Dad, look!!

question: Hang on!
answer: Dad! Watch out!

question: Stay calm, son. We'll be fine. That Jedi won't be able to follow us through this.
answer: Got him! Yeahhhhh!

question: Understood, Master.
answer: They'll never get there in time to save him. They have to come half way across the galaxy. Look, Geonosis is less than a parsec away.

question: If he's still alive.
answer: Annie, are you just going to sit here and let him die?? He's your friend... your mentor...

question: ...He's like my father, but you heard Master Windu. He gave me strict orders to stay here.
answer: He gave you strict orders to protect me... ...and I'm going to save Obi-Wan. So if you plan to protect me, you will have to come along.

question: Hey, where are you going?
answer: To find Obi-Wan.

question: No! You're not!
answer: Let go of me!

question: I'm not letting you go out there. It's too dangerous. It's my job to protect you. I said it's too dangerous. You're not going, and that's final!
answer: It's empty! Wait!

question: Don't be afraid. What are you talking about? You love me?! I thought we decided not to fall in love. That we would be forced to live a lie. That it would destroy our lives... I have no desire to be cured of this love either. Long or short, I vow to spend the rest of my life with you.
answer: I was beginning to wonder if you had gotten my message.

question: I retransmitted it as you requested, Master. Then we decided to come and rescue you.
answer: It looks like you're going a good job so far.

question: I have a bad feeling about this.
answer: Take the one the left. I'll take the one on the right.

question: What about Padme?
answer: It looks like she's already on top of things.

question: Patiece, Viceroy... she will die. Maybe this is the way it's supposed to end. Master Windu, how pleasant of you to join us. You're just in time for the moment of truth. I would think these two new boys of yours could use a little more training.
answer: Sorry to disappoint you, Dooku. This party's over.

question: Brave, but stupid, my old Jedi friend. You're impossibly outnumbered.
answer: I don't think so. One Jedi has to be worth a hundred Geonosians.

question: Hold on! Look over there...
answer: It's Dooku, go after him! Padme!!! Put the ship down! Down!

question: No! Forget her. We have to go after Dooku.
answer: No we're not!! Land this ship!

question: Don't let your personal feelings get in the way. We've got a job to do.
answer: I don't care!.. Go back.

question: Kenobi, isn't it? As you can see, my Jedi powers are far beyond yours. Now, back down.
answer: I don't think so.

question: Ah, but if I must. I have spent the last ten years learning to use the power of the Dark Side. It gives me infinitely greater power.
answer: You will have to prove it.
